entry.title: HexoBlog Development Log (Part 2/4)
entry.content:
This article documents and explains how my HexoBlog was deployed to Github Pages step by step, from zero to present, welcome for you to reference. Here is My HexoBlog.

Part 1 - Preparation

  • Having a Git account
  • Install nodejs and Git
  • Install and Initialize Hexo Blog

Part 2 - Basic configuration and blog deployment

  1. Basic Blog configuration

  2. Deploy a blog for the first time with GitPage

  3. Install blog theme - “Butterfly”

  4. Develop a own picture hosting (PicGo + GitHub)

Part 3 - Blog maintain and GitHub version control

  • Use of Hexo command
  • Deploy a blog with theme
  • Push source file to GitHub

Part 4 - Advanced configuration based on “Butterfly” theme

  • Config blog attributer and Customize blog style with “Butterfly”

Basic blog configuration - _config.yml

Please always refer to Hexo official Doc - EN Hexo - Configuration and CN Hexo - Configuration.

  1. Open …/YourBlogSource/_config.yml with any text/code editor. Recommend test editor: sublime text, Atom and any IDE & code editor.

  2. Important - Site: define basic state of the HexoBlog. Every attribute have not fix format.

    Hexo Offical doc - “Site” Configuration

    Hexo 官方文檔 - “網站” 配置

    User of fas icon<i class='fas fa-map-marker-alt'></i>, please refer to HexoBlog Development Log (Part 4) - Advanced configuration based on “Butterfly” theme

  3. Important - URL: define global url to the blog after we deploy.

    Hexo Offical doc - “URL” Configuration

    Hexo 官方文檔 - “網址” 配置

    • url: must following the format https://<GitHub-Username.github.io>.github.io. Note: not repo url.

  4. Important - Deployment: define deploy method. Re-request of blog GitPage-deployment.

    1. type: git , fixed
    2. repo: https://github.com/becoze/becoze.github.io.git, must use your url of the repo.
    3. branch: main, main or any branch

Deploy a blog for the first time with GitPage

Hexo Offical doc - “One-command deployment” GitHub Pages

Hexo 官方文檔 - “一鍵部屬” 在 GitHub Pages 上部署 Hexo

  1. Install Hexo Blog deployer: npm install hexo-deployer-git --save at blog root directory /HexoBlog

  2. Make sure complete Part 2 step 2.4.

  3. Deployment: run following using Git Bash at blog root directory /HexoBlog

  4. Possible error (optional)

    ​ solution:

    • run git config --global user.email "<you@example.com>", your GitHub email address
    • run git config --global user.name "<username>", your GitHub username

5. Developed own Image hosting - “PicGo + GitHub”

Tutorial Bilibili 使用picgo+github搭建免费个人图床

  1. Create a new Public repo in GitHub with any name to store image, and add a README.md

  2. Obtain token: GitHub setting –> Developer setting –> Personal access tokens –> Generate new token

    • Note: any (for example “becozePictureHosting”)
    • Expiration: any (for example 60 days)
    • Select Scopes:
      • repo: MUST select all
      • all other: remain deselect

  3. Make sure to copy your personal access token now. You won’t be able to see it again!

  4. Download PicGo exe. file from GitHub at PicGo Release

    ​ PicGo-Setup-2.3.0-x64.exe for Windows

    ​ PicGo-Setup-2.3.0-x64.dmg for Mac iOS

  5. Image hosting setting 图床设置 –> GitHub图床

    • 设定仓库名:

    • 设定分支名:

    • 设定Token: (from step 5.2)

    • 指定储存路径:

    • 设定自定义域名: 加速静态资源加载

Install and apply blog theme - “Butterfly”

x. Config blog attributer and Customize blog style with “Butterfly”

Please always refer to official Doc - Butterfly Doc. Note: Doc written in Chinese.

x. Push source file to GitHub

Please always refer to Hexo official Doc EN Hexo - Deployment and CN Hexo - Deployment

  1. Create / Make-sure a .gitignore file at blog root directory /HexoBlog, contain following information

  2. Create a new Private repo in GitHub to store source file, for example /BlogSource

  3. Create a git repo: run git int

  4. Select the file need to be pushed: run git add .

  5. Push file to local: run git commit -m "First commit"

  6. Select GitHub branch to be upload: run git branch -M main

  7. Connect to GitHub online: run git remote add origin https://github.com/becoze/BlogSource.git

  8. Push file: run git push -u origin main

x.1. Recover all the file from GitHub

  1. Obtain GitHub repo url: go to your GitHub repositories, copy the HTTPS url under code. For example: https://github.com/becoze/BlogSource.git
  2. Clone file: run git clone https://github.com/becoze/BlogSource.git at your file. It will become your blog root file.

entry.title: HexoBlog Development Log (Part 1/4)
entry.content:
This article documents and explains how my HexoBlog was deployed to Github Pages step by step, from zero to present, welcome for you to reference. If your are not at my Blog, here is My HexoBlog.

Chapter:

Part 1 - Preparation

  1. Having a Git account and repositories for blog

  2. Install nodejs and Git

  3. Install and Initialize Hexo Blog

Part 2 - Basic configuration and blog deployment

  • Basic Blog configuration
  • Deploy a blog for the first time with GitHub
  • Install blog theme - “Butterfly”
  • Develop a own picture hosting (PicGo + GitHub)

Part 3 - Blog maintain and GitHub version control

  • Use of Hexo command
  • Deploy a blog with theme
  • Push source file to GitHub

Part 4 - Advanced configuration on “Butterfly” theme

  • Config blog attributer and Customize blog style with “Butterfly”

Having a GitHub account

  1. Skip this step if have a GitHub account already.
  2. Go to GitHub and then “sign up”.
  3. Sign up with eMail, password and username.
  4. Create “New Repo”: Click the greed “New”;
    • Owner: <GitHub-Username>
    • Repository name: <GitHub-Username.github.io>; Important
    • Description: <any>
    • Public; Important
    • Add a README file: <click> optional; yes
    • Add .gitignoreChoose: <unclick> optional; currently no
    • Choose a license: <unclick> optional; currently no
    • Finish by clicking “Create repository”

Install nodejs and Git

Link: nodejs download

  1. File download: download .msi for Window; .pkg for macOS.

  2. Download setting: keep licking “Next” (remain all default installation)

  3. Verify download: run node -v on command prompt. Installation success when it return the version number.

Link: Git download

  1. File download: “64-bit Git for Windows Setup”

  2. Download setting: keep licking “Next” (remain all default installation)

  3. Verify download: run git version on command prompt. Installation success when it return the version number.

Install and Initialize Hexo blog

Please always refer to Hexo Official doc: Official Hexo doc EN and Official Hexo doc CN

Video tutorial CN: YouTube: 周三Tech - Hexo教程第二期 安装与使用; Bilibili: 周三Josan - Hexo系列教程第二期 安装与使用 720P

Video tutorial EN: YouTube

  1. Create a new empty folder with any name at the appropriate path, this folder will become your blog source folder. e.g. “HexoBlog”, path D:\HexoBlog.

  2. Use of Git terminal: Open the blog source folder, right click select Git Bash to enter the terminal.

  3. Install Hexo: at blog root directory /HexoBlog

  4. Initialize blog: at blog root directory /HexoBlog

  5. Generate blog file: at blog root directory /HexoBlog

  6. Deploy the HexoBlog locally: at blog root directory /HexoBlog,

​ and open http://localhost:4000/ with any browser to view the blog locally.

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

More info: Writing
